Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Big Fish" to you.
"The Big Fish" is a 2004 American biographical drama film directed by Tim Burton and starring Ewan McGregor and Tilda Swinton.
The film tells the story of Bilbo Baggins, an elderly hobbit who lives with his nephew Bilbo. When Bilbo gets a mysterious letter from "Silly" Sauron," the hobbit must leave his home to go on a quest to find out what the letter is and why he received it.
The film explores themes such as friendship, adventure, and perseverance.
Overall, "The Big Fish" is a well-made biographical drama film that tells an engaging story of Bilbo Baggins, an elderly hobbit who lives with his nephew Bilbo.

This movie has received positive reviews from both critics and audiences alike. It has been praised for its compelling storyline, well-developed characters, and excellent cinematography.
Additionally, this movie has also been lauded for its thought-provoking themes of life after death, the power of choice, and the consequences of one's actions.
Overall, based on your preferences, I would recommend the movie "The Secret" from the list you provided.
